title: 8 Tips For Dry Climate Gardening Without Irrigation (Dust Mulch Wide Spacing Hugelpaths Etc.)

subtasks: Create depressions for planting to capture rainwater
Use wood chips as mulch to suppress weeds and reduce evaporation
Maintain wide plant spacing to facilitate nutrient and water uptake
Create hugel paths using rotted wood to store water for dry periods
Utilize natural mulches such as straw, grass clippings, or rocks to cover soil
Break up dust mulch after heavy rainfall to prevent moisture loss
Plant in hills or clumps with adequate spacing for water capture
Pre-germinate or soak seeds before planting during dry periods
Use organic matter like compost to improve soil moisture retention
Incorporate hugelkultur techniques by burying wood to act as a water reservoir
